direction.raw_text: platform PAST a line of sleeping figures, consisting of a couple of drunks, an Indian, two Mexicans and a mongrel dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the window of the ticket office. Inside the office can be glimpsed the Station Agent dozing in a chair with his feet up against the grill of the ticket window. The clicking of the signal indicator is heard. The agent opens his eyes, flips up the indicator and begins to get to his feet sleepily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: line of sleeping figures, with dog in f.g. The sound of a distant train whistle is heard o.s. The dog, which up to now might have been dead, opens one eye and looks past camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: railway track with the three-car train approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: line of sleeping figures. The dog jumps up barking furiously and runs out of shot past camera. The sleeping figures come to life and look toward camera. At the same time, the door of the ticket office opens and the agent appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: railway track. The train is now almost at the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- with the line of men now standing on the edge of the platform looking toward camera. Train steams slowly in past camera, and stops, with a tall, wide-shouldered man of about 28 (Rocklin), dressed in new store clothes, cowboots and a broad-brimmed white hat, in f. g. standing on steps of day coach with a small valise and saddle in his hands. Behind Rocklin a conductor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: baggage car. The baggageman is standing at the open door of the car with two sacks of mail. He drops them to the platform and waves to the conductor o.s. and begins to close the doors of the baggage car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT on Station Agent and conductors. The latter signals the engineer. The train whistle sounds again o.s. and the shadow of the moving train begins to pass across the Station Agent's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Rocklin comes along the platform carrying the valise in one hand and balancing the saddle on his shoulder with the other, a man behind him picks up the two mail sacks and exits from scene. The station bums look at Rocklin curiously. His expression giving no encouragement, they slink back out of the sun and begin to settle down in their old places again. At the ticket office, Rocklin pauses and looks around uncertainly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (at office door) Expectin' someone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a second's pause) I guess not. Where's the stagecoach office?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) Back of the depot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The stage is drawn up in front of the depot, over which is a sign -- RED ROCK STAGE J. Harolday Proprietor Rocklin, making his way along the walk, almost reaches the depot when his attention is arrested by the sight of Dave, the stage driver, who has just rounded in front of the lead horses. He pauses close to one horse's head. Rocklin sees Dave take a bottle from his person, uncork it as he glances around, and raise it to drink. The bottle is almost to Dave's lips when the horse shies, swinging its head. The bottle is knocked from the old fellow's hands and smashes on the ground. Now Rocklin witnesses a scene of intense fury, which he finds amusing despite its seriousness. Old Dave rants and snorts -- beats his thighs, his heads, flings his arms wildly and exhibits his utter disgust generally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops talking abruptly because his hand has, quite by chance, felt the spare bottle he carries, which he has forgotten in his anger. A most satisfying smile lights his bewhiskered face as he brings the bottle into view. He uncorks it, and stepping a few paces from the horse, raises the bottle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to horse) Consarn you, Blossom -- lookit that -- jus' lookit what you done -- (some more pantomime) I'm tellin' you, Blossom that -- (indicating broken bottle)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: makes you the most aggravatin' female as ever I had a despise fer -- I've got a good notion to pizen you -- an' what's more --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Blossom) Heh-heh -- fooled you, didn't I? -- (chuckles) Fooled myself, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: who has been watching Dave's performance. He smiles his amusement and now proceeds toward the stage office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rocklin enters and moves over to the counter, behind which is the stage agent, a mild-looking man with pebble- lens glasses. During the scene, the character who picked up the mail sacks from the platform, comes in, dumps the sacks on the counter and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin puts his saddle on the counter, and taking out a wad of bills, drops them on the counter. The Stage Agent counts out the fare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Stage Agent turns to make out the ticket. Rocklin takes some tobacco and paper from his vest pocket as he glances outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes his head and hands Rocklin the ticket, and moves over to the door with one of the mail sacks in his hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Rocklin) Howdy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating stage) That the stage for Santa Inez?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Leaving any minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Santa Inez -- seventeen-fifty -- (returning the balance) Name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rocklin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mind if I ride alongside the driver?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over his specs) It's all right with me -- if it's all right with Dave -- He's mad -- His last trip -- Had a row with Harolday, the boss -- Old-timer, Dave -- an' a grumpy old cuss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (soberly) I like grumpy old cusses -- Hope to live long enough to be one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled) Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Stage Agent, carrying a mail sack, and Rocklin come from the stage depot and reach the stage as Dave is in the act of climbing up to the driver's seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave looks over his shoulder at the Agent and steps to the ground, as Rocklin climbs up to the driver's seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave glares at Rocklin climbing up to the seat, and he is about to order him down when Rocklin, now seated, looks down at him and asks rather wistfully -- ROCKLIN Mind if I ride up here? Dave does mind, but his better judgment tells him to step carefully in his attitude toward this stranger, who does things first, then asks permission. His only answer to Rocklin is a characteristic grimace which is eloquent enough. And now Dave turns on the Agent, who becomes the target of his pent-up wrath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave stalks around the rear of the coach. The Agent meantime stretches himself up toward Rocklin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave has climbed to his seat, and now the coach lurches away, leaving the Agent shaking his head dubiously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here's your mail, Dave --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as he steps up to the seat)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: and a passenger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's them wimmen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Up at the hotel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yanking mail sack from Agent) Why ain't they here? -- This is the stage depot, ain't it -- ? (heaves sack into boot) Ain't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can pick 'em up there -- it's only up the street -- DAVE On'y up the street -- an' they cain't walk it -- What's the matter -- don't Easterners have laigs like other folks?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (so Dave won't hear) Hold tight when you git in the mountains, mister -- When he gits riled you can hear the passengers prayin' for miles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: From the porch of the hotel. We see the stage approaching as the hotel handyman brings a trunk and a couple of bags from the hotel to the street. The coach pulls up and stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before the handyman can answer, Dave's attention is taken by someone calling his name from across the street. Meantime, an Indian squaw wobbles from the hotel with bow and arrow, etc. Rocklin buys bow and arrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave goes to the rear of the coach.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to handyman) Whar's them wimmen? -- They waitin' for you to carry 'em out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as he comes to Dave) Dave -- Dave -- tell Arly Harolday her saddle ain't ready yet, will ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (getting to the ground) I ain't tellin' that crazy female nothin' -- Last time I seen her she threatened to rip the hide off'n me and bat me dizzy with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks up to Rocklin) Mister -- will you tell the Agent at Santa Inez to tell Miss Harolday her saddle ain't ready yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) I'll say that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Miss Martin steps out onto the porch followed by Clara and a gentleman, presumably the hotel manager or clerk. The women are obviously Easterners and are attired in the good taste of the period. Miss Martin is a domineering woman, approaching middle age. Her niece, Clara, is a well-bred, attractive girl of twenty-one and completely under the influence of the older woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Martin stops short and looks o.s.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as group comes through door) By next year, madam, we expect to have a bathtub on each floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: having a time lifting the trunk up into the boot. Miss Martin and the others come into the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave pauses to see who is talking.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ON DAVE AT REAR OF THE COUCH

dialogue.raw_text: Now don't drop it --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At your age you'd best not be lifting things so heavy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimaces) Mebbe you're young enough to hoist her up your own self. (tries to lift trunk again)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on Clara. She is looking rather timidly up at Rocklin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Rocklin. He is grinning appreciatively at old Dave. Now he notices Clara and regards her soberly a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave has heaved the trunk in place and is securing it. Miss Martin, about to enter the coach, notices Clara staring up at Rocklin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clara snaps her attention from Rocklin to her aunt. The Clerk steps to the side of the coach and opens the door. He assists Clara inside -- and now Miss Martin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Clara!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Miss Martin and Clara. Miss Martin is just sitting. She looks coldly at Clara.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in low voice) Staring as though you'd never seen a man before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dave, Rocklin and Clerk. Dave is at the moment climbing to his seat on the other side of the coach. The Clerk swings the door closed and looks up to Rocklin and speaks more or less confidentially.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Try to hold him down or he'll scare the women to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He is looking down at the Clerk and answers quite casually, but loud enough to be heard by the women.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I never feel sorry for anything that happens to a woman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: window of door -- Miss Martin and Clara. The women have obviously overheard Rocklin's remark. Miss Martin smiles vindictively at Clara, who flushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to include the Clerk, who moves to the coach door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I hope you have a nice trip, ladies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope we get there -- wouldn't surprise me if we didn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: On Dave and Rocklin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes up the reins and shouts the team away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ARIZONA COUNTRY - DAY EXTREME LONG SHOT -- with the stage hardly more than a black dot below, its curl of rising dust in the midst of the whole broad expanse. As the coach disappears from shot, the two mounted men appear riding at an easy pace and continue in the same direction as the coach.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (mutters) Wait till I get you on the road, you old buzzard, you'll be surprised all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT -- Dave and Rocklin, the latter staring straight ahead. As they roll with the roll of the coach, Dave steals a look at his companion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin ignores Dave's question and continues staring ahead. Dave glances down toward the women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He breaks off and chuckles again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave doesn't reply, but lifting the pint of whiskey, jerks out the cork with one movement of his thumbnail.

direction.raw_text: Rocklin drinks and gives the bottle back to Dave, who all but empties it in one pull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin makes no reply. Dave offers the bottle again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I wonder why a young feller who don't have to wants to come into this God danged country?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say -- did you mean what you said back there about wimmen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) Every word of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chuckling) Then you're smarter than most.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I seen more of 'em than most.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at him admiringly) Shouldn't be surprised. Shouldn't be a leetle bit surprised. (reflectively) All the same...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (unsmilingly) All the same -- what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (offering bottle to Rocklin) Take a slug.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (holding up the bottle and squinting through it) Whiskey and wimmen -- ever think how much alike they are? Both fool you, but you never figger out how to do without 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take another.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not just yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (unoffended) Well... (putting the bottle to his lips) Here's to her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The next one that fools you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT -- Clara and Miss Martin. The former is showing the effects of the rough ride, but the old lady is hanging on grimly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave straightens up, grinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He whips up the team, at the same time weaving a little unsteadily in his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The coach hits a particularly bad bit of road and there is an exclamation from inside. Dave grins and urges the team on cheerfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIM - ARIZONA COUNTRY - DAY FULL SHOT -- as Dave pulls up the stage at the top of a long downgrade and looks out appreciatively at the view. From this crest of the rim, a vast expanse of country is visible.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (with relish) Mighty rough stretch along here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like me to speel you a while?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope. I've had a few snorts but that don't make no difference. Leas'ways, never has... (after a second's pause) Don't ever git wore out, and useless, like me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who're them as say you are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harolday, for one. Oh, I ain't belly- aching. Reckon he's entitled to his opinion. But him and me never did see eye to eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's constitootional, I reckon. Like that step-daughter of his is crazy -- he's too sane. Believes In law and order.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning) What's wrong with law and order?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Depends on who's a-dishin' it out. Never was good at takin' orders meself. As for the law -- well, you'll soon find out what that means 'round these parts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stage. Miss Martin thrusts her head out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave brightens visibly at this challenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His whip cracks like a rifle shot and the startled horses literally jerk the heavy stage over the rim and down the grade.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Driver? Driver, what's the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothin'. Restin' hosses. Git out and stretch yore laigs if you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Resting horses? What for? I can see with my own eyes it's downhill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You in such an all-fired hurry, lady?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Certainly, we are in a hurry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beaming) Well -- we'll hurry some.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: grade, with the stagecoach bounding and reeling down the narrow road and around the sharp bends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FULL SHOT Dave and Rocklin on stage as it thunders downhill. Dave is leaning out and listening hopefully for the outcries from within. None come. Rocklin is hanging on with both hands and mildly amused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two women are really being scrambled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT -- Dave and Rocklin. Rocklin is as calm as if he were walking. Dave is more and more pleased with himself. He again leans out to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grade, with coach approaching in b.g. In f.g. the road narrows and makes a sharp turn at the very edge of a precipice. There is no possible way of getting the coach safely around this turn except at a walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: road, from point of view of driver's seat, establishing the same menace ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT Dave and Rocklin, as Rocklin glances out of the corner of his eyes as if wondering whether or not Dave is too drunk to perceive the disaster. He makes no move, however, to advise or interfere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: road; at danger corner, as stage comes in. At the very last second, Dave pulls in the horses and negotiates the turn in safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stage. Dave grins at Rocklin, then listens for the outcry he expects from the women within. The old lady's head bobs out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Dave's mouth drops open, and as Rocklin begins to grin at his discomfiture.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (fiercely) Now what's the matter. Why are we stopping again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STAN'S PLACE - DAY FULL SHOT of lonely adobe which serves as a combination roadhouse, stage station and bar. As the coach rolls into f.g., a little Mexican boy (Pablo) runs out to change the horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances pointedly at Dave who is climbing down unsteadily and Pablo bursts out laughing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as Rocklin swings down) Buenas noches, senor.

dialogue.raw_text: Buenas noches, amigo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning at the friendly tone) Ha llegado anticipademente, senor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tuvimos suerte en haber llegado.

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT on door of coach. As Dave comes into shot, Miss Martin's head pops out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and lurches toward the roadhouse.

dialogue.raw_text: (gruffly) We stop here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do we stop here?

dialogue.raw_text: Will you please stop referring to my legs!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got some, ain't you?

direction.raw_text: . STAN'S PLACE - DAY FULL SHOT from doorway. It is a large barn-like room on one side of which is a bar. On the other side is a fireplace and a partition behind which is a rough dining table and benches. Standing at the bar drinking with his back to the door is a wizened little man, dressed in an odd assortment of ragged garments of unrecognizable origin. On the counter is a travelling prospector's pack, to which is strapped an assortment of prospector's equipment, including a pick and shovel. As Dave enters, the man (Zeke) turns around and reveals a face even hairier than Dave's.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (holding out his arms) Dave!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (letting out a yell and rushing to Zeke) Why, Zeke, you two-legged old coot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Zeke and Dave as they beat one another on the back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Whar you been all these months?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Up in the hills workin' my way down the biggest hole you ever seed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good -- What's at the bottom of it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothin'!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (roaring with laughter) What, again!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rocklin has entered and moved to the fire. Miss Martin and Clara enter and stand in the doorway watching the scene at the bar. A pale-faced, dyspeptic-looking man of about 45 (Stan) comes from the kitchen and approaches them ingratiatingly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening, ladies. How about something to eat?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a dubious look toward the pair at the bar) Well -- if it won't take too long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (leading the way toward the partition) This way, ladies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT bar. Dave has just fitted a cylindrical record of "She Was Only a Bird in a Gilded Cage" to an old-type phonograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both yell with laughter and slap one another on the back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yep -- this is my last trip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Old Harolday won't take back what he said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What'd he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "You're fired."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: from fireplace. Rocklin is standing in f.g. looking down at the fire and making the inevitable cigarette from his pocket dip. Seated at the table are Clara and Miss Martin. From o.s. comes the sound of Zeke and Dave singing to the phonograph record. Miss Martin glares indignantly in the direction of the bar, obviously about to make a protest. At this moment Stan comes from the kitchen with a large dish in his hand which he dumps on the table.

direction.raw_text: Miss Martin, sitting forward eagerly, suddenly sees the dish of meat and freezes.

dialogue.raw_text: There you are, folks. Dig in and help y'rselves.

direction.raw_text: Miss Martin as she shudders dyspeptically and closes her eyes.

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT bar, as Stan comes from the table to Dave and Zeke.

dialogue.raw_text: Supper, Dave?

dialogue.raw_text: (noisily) I'm drinkin' mine. Set 'em up.

direction.raw_text: table. Clara has filled a plate with food, which she offers to her aunt.

direction.raw_text: Clara hesitates for a second, then looks across to Rocklin.

direction.raw_text: He comes to table and begins to help himself. There is a loud burst of laughter from the bar.

direction.raw_text: Clara looks apologetically at Rocklin, then away again nervously. Suddenly, she sees something o.s. and drops her knife and fork with a little start.

dialogue.raw_text: Auntie -- MISS MARTIN With my dyspepsia? Do you want to kill me?

dialogue.raw_text: Aren't you going to have any supper?

dialogue.raw_text: Reckon so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Young man, that driver's had all the liquor he can take.

dialogue.raw_text: Has he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know he has. You're not a complete fool, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Frequently.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Clara, furiously) The rudeness of people in these parts is appalling!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT window. A thin, unpleasant-looking face is seen through the glass. The windowpane is defective and so distorts the lower part of the face into a hideous smile. It is the younger of the two men who were watching the coach outside the hotel.

direction.raw_text: on kitchen door as Stan comes through with a dish of potatoes. A man's voice is heard o.s. and he pulls up abruptly.

direction.raw_text: NED TO include the side door next to the window and almost opposite to the dining table. The owner of the face at the window (Bob Clews) is now standing in the doorway. Behind him is the man with the sheriff's badge on his dirty vest (Jackson). As they come forward toward Stan, the latter shows obvious signs of nervousness.

direction.raw_text: Jackson, as though noticing the women for the first time, raises his hat.

direction.raw_text: Miss Martin gives Clews an icy stare and snaps her eyes to Jackson.

direction.raw_text: Rocklin speaks from where he leans against the wall, casually smoking.

direction.raw_text: There's a pause in which all have turned their attention to Rocklin.

direction.raw_text: Jackson and Clews exchange a quick glance.

direction.raw_text: Jackson follows, looking at the women.

direction.raw_text: Jackson follows Stan into the kitchen. Clews moves to the fire and lunges there picking his teeth and eyeing Clara, who stirs uneasily under the man's gaze.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Doin' yourself well these days, Stan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A friend of mine was by an' sold me a quarter of beef.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (insinuatingly) The same friend as sold you that hide Bob, here, found stashed in your barn yesterday?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hide -- What hide?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The one that might send you to the penitentiary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smugly) What did you do with it, Stan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never had no hide stashed -- BOB CLEWS (harshly) I saw it yesterday under the hay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then it must still be there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No it ain't -- we looked -- Where is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I tell ya -- MISS MARTIN (who has been an interested witness) What is all this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Afternoon ma'am. Miz Caldwell ain't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- Martin -- Miss Martin -- This is Miss Caldwell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Clara) Glad to know you, miss -- Been expectin' you at Santa Inez. I'm Sheriff Jackson. Any relation of Red Caldwell's a friend of mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (that oily smile) You're sure gonna brighten things up considerable around the K.C. Ranch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating Stan) What's going on with him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a little matter of the law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hastily) Rustlin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wrestling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rustlin' -- cattle stealin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh -- a thief -- STAN (visibly worried) I tell ya I never -- BOB CLEWS (quickly) Save it -- JACKSON (to Miss Martin) Matter of fact -- Bob, here, says that the hide he saw yesterday had the K.C. brand on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh -- hmmm -- well, what do you intend doing about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at Stan) Law's pretty harsh 'round here on cattle thieves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (being the kind man) Course, we don't want to make a mistake with an old-timer, but --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about the owner of that beef -- mightn't he have somethin' to say about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Meanin'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Red Caldwell -- he's the owner of the K.C., ain't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a short chuckle) You're 'way behind the herd, mister -- Red Caldwell died three weeks ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (glaring at Clews) Was murdered, you mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right -- shot in the back -- not far from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (significantly to Stan) Maybe he was gettin' on to things about the cattle that's been missin' from the K.C. lately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I tell ya I ain't never had any hide -- BOB CLEWS (quickly) Well, you got beef -- STAN (meekly defiant) Yes -- an' I got a bill of sale fer it, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: S'pose you let me see that bill of sale.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (starts for kitchen) It's right out here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like I said -- I wouldn't want to make a mistake with an ole-timer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Rocklin comes out of the thoughtful mood in which he has been plunged by the information about Red Caldwell and notes the by-play between Clews and Clara. He frowns and makes a movement as if about to rise. At the same time, Dave and Zeke, whose voices have been heard throughout In the b.g., stagger into the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeke takes it and staggers into the b.g. near Bob Clews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeke opens his mouth to speak, and slowly folds up, sliding down the wall to the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (chuckling and pointing to Miss Martin) See that one? (confidentially) She ain't got no laigs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold your tongue. (to Zeke, who is gaping at her) And you -- stop staring as if we were monsters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Rocklin) Where's Stan? We got to have another drink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's outside tryin' to explain away a hide.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating food) Seems we're eatin' stolen beef.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody's loco. Stan might have given house-room to bit o' dead beef, but he'd never be fool enough to leave the hide lyin' around. (to Zeke) How 'bout it, Zeke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Clews comes from the fireplace and joins the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave has gone to Zeke's aid and now peers at Clews closely, recognizing him for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan and Jackson come from the kitchen. Dave is again picking up Zeke, but seeing Stan, lets Zeke drop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jackson addresses everyone present with an indulgent Smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeke, on the floor, takes up Dave's belligerent mood for a flash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jackson goes to Dave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clews moves in to Jackson and Dave, and now both men urge Dave toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They exit. Rocklin stands frowning a second, then turns toward the table where Stan is making a show of clearing dishes, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin's lips curl in a wise smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeke is discovered on all fours crawling around on the floor near the table where the women sit. He seems to be looking for something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeke turns his hairy face up toward Miss Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door leading from the barn opens and Jackson enters followed by Clews a few steps behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin has been listening intently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's the way it is, Dave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disgustedly) Oh -- it's you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right -- your old pal Bob Clews.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shoves Clews) Git away from me -- you two-timin' horse thief.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning) Them's fightin' words, pardner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moving to Stan) Hey, Stan -- don't let 'em hang nothin' on you, you ain't done. They're just a couple of fourflushers -- the pair of 'em, everybody knows that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Crazy drunk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wheels on Jackson) Mebbe I am drunk -- mebbe that's why I'm tellin' the truth -- I'm drunk an' I'll say what I think -- I'll say what I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So will -- I -- (goes out again)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't act up this ways, Dave -- They's women watchin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (attempting to throw them off) Git your hands off me -- BOB CLEWS (to company in general) What he needs is a short lay-down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking a step forward) I'll lend a hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (brushing past him) Me an' Bob'll look after him. We're his friends -- come on, Bob. (as they steer Dave through door) Careful now -- don't hurt him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly to Stan) How are things standin' now between you an' the law? (indicates direction Jackson went out)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not wanting to talk about it particularly) All right, I reckon -- (looks at Rocklin; more confidently) I guess this bill of sale -- (indicates it in Vest pocket)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: kinda winded him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good thing you saved it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mystified) What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Musta been dreamin' -- Thought I was sittin' on a pot of gold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wearily) There ain't no gold here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (takes it) There ain't even a pot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Went to sleep soon's we laid him down. (pulling off hat again) Sorry to have a ruckus in front of you ladies. Dave's an ornery old cuss when he gets goin' -- No shape to drive on, I'm afraid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (this is a fine kettle of fish) Hmmm -- JACKSON Don't worry, ma'am. Bob, here, 'll take you on in -- knows every inch of the road -- Don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grins) You bet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm drivin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of the group, with Clews looking significantly at Jackson, who is obviously checkmated by Rocklin's remark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns abruptly and walks out the front door to the coach. Jackson stares after him a moment, uncertain. Now he turns to the women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Martin hesitates.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (finally speaks) But if anything was to happen to the ladies, I'd feel -- to blame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ladies want he should drive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be more'n glad to accommodate you -- (smiles at Clara)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (resenting Clews' familiarity) He's going with us anyway -- he may as well drive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anything you say, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STAN'S PLACE - LATE AFTERNOON MED. SHOT -- coach as Rocklin moves toward it from the house. A crudely made arrow shoots in and hits Rocklin lightly. A warning hiss is heard o.s. and he turns quickly in the direction of the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STAN'S PLACE - LATE AFTERNOON MED. SHOT -- door of stable. The little Mexican who attended the horses is peering out from the stable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid disappears inside the stable. Rocklin comes into shot from the direction of the coach and enters the stable.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in a whisper) Venga con migo, senor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: STAN'S PLACE - LATE AFTERNOON Rocklin comes through the door and moves toward the boy, who is standing looking downward into some hay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S DOWN to show Dave unconscious, with a nasty cut in his scalp. Rocklin kneels into the shot. Over the scene comes the sound of retreating hoofbeats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STAN'S PLACE - LATE AFTERNOON LONG SHOT -- from Rocklin's ANGLE in the stable, of Jackson and Bob Clews riding away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STAN'S PLACE - LATE AFTERNOON SHOT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kneels again, picks Dave up, and prepares to carry him out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to boy) Did they do it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Si, senor. They hit him with a pistola.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (matters) His friends, eh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HIGHWAY - ROAD TO SANTA INEZ - NIGHT LONG SHOT of stagecoach traveling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin on the driver's seat, handling the reins expertly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- with Miss Martin and Clara now seated next to one another. Clara is half asleep with her head against the side of the coach. Miss Martin is sitting bolt upright but her eyes are closed and her head nods. CAMERA PANS to include the other side of the coach where Dave is sprawled in the seat, his head on a cushion, his mouth open, sound asleep. Suddenly he snores violently, and Miss Martin wakes with a start and glares at him angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STAGE DEPOT - SANTA INEZ - NIGHT PANNING SHOT on sign on window which reads:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Proprietor -- J. Harolday
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: RED ROCK STAGE SANTA INEZ DEPOT

direction.raw_text: S to show the coach pulled up outside, with Rocklin lifting his saddle from the top of the coach, whilst a stableman holds up Dave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bumped his head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (skeptically) Where -- on Iron Mountain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the best chance of a cheap room?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) There's Cap's place across the Street -- the Sun-Up Saloon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with valise, indicates saddle) I'll pick that up later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: group, to include the window of the coach. Miss Martin's head appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two move out of shot across the road, followed by the indignant gaze of Miss Martin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to stableman) This isn't the hotel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No'm, lady. Hotel's up the street a piece.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are we expected to carry our bags at this time of night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Rocklin) Want to drive 'em on up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flatly) Nope. (offering a shoulder to Dave) Here -- catch aholt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- opening on the sign over the door, which reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to show Rocklin and Dave coming along the boardwalk in front of the saloon. CAMERA PANS them to the swing-doors, which Rocklin pushes open, passing through into the saloon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- SHOOTING FROM BEHIND the bar toward the swing- doors as Dave and Rocklin enter. The bartender (Cap), a lean, tallish man of about 50, studies them as they enter, then turns and calls across the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Doc!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: S to show a group of poker players seated around a table. This consists of a well-dressed, powerful-looking man of about 45 (Judge Garvey), with a smooth face and an impressive manner; a flashily-dressed young man with a weak face (Clint Harolday); a tough-looking cowboy of about 35 (Ab Jenkins); a pleasant-faced storekeeper of about 50 (Pap Fossler); and a little man with a weather-beaten face and intensely blue eyes (Doc Riding). Watching the game are Sam Haynes and Shorty Davis, the former a townsman and the latter a cowboy. As they all look toward the door, Cap's voice continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc Riding looks quickly toward the door, taking in the situation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Customer --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Haynes) Take my hand, Sammy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Rocklin and Dave come to the bar. At the same time, Doc Riding comes into shot from the poker table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bartender looks dubious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Rocklin and Doc Riding begin to lead Dave toward the Stairs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bumped his head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dryly) I see. (examining the head) Looks like he's going to need a couple or so stitches. (to Cap) Better get him upstairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding) Okay. You can book me a room, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAVE'S BEDROOM - SUN-UP SALOON - NIGHT TRUCKING SHOT -- starting on big head of Dave, as he lies in bed, with his eyes closed. His head is swathed in a clean bandage. He stirs and gives a little chuckle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (muttering) No laigs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to show Doc Riding at the bed and Rocklin beyond, standing in the connecting doorway between two bedrooms. The latter has a face towel in his hands and has evidently been washing up. As Dave settles down comfortably in the bed, Doc Riding closes his bag, nods to Rocklin and moves toward the second bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT -- as Doc Riding comes through the doorway from Dave's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin closes door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves across the room, followed by Rocklin, who throws the towel down on the bed as he passes. For a second, he hesitates as if about to pick up the gun-belt which is lying on the bed. Then, deciding to leave it, he follows the doctor through the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He'll be all right in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about a snort?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't mind if I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SUN-UP SALOON - NIGHT MED. CLOSE SHOT -- at bar, with Cap Setting up glasses for Doc Riding and Rocklin. He nods to indicate the bedroom upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cap reverts to Rocklin, still casually, but with an undertone of friendly warning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They down the drinks. There is a burst of excited comment from o.s. and they all look around toward the poker table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (with a grin) Will he make it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure he'll make it. Can't kill off a salty old hairpin like Dave that easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right. Reckon Saint Peter must be gitten' mighty tired of dustin' off that doormat for him. (to Rocklin) By the way, how did you say it happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stolidly) I didn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a slight nod of approval) That's right; you didn't. (casually) Reason I ask is, a couple fellers was in saying how Dave was kickin' up a ruckus up at Stan's place. (to Doc Riding) Sheriff Jackson it was and one of the Clewses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a look of distaste) Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tough customers, the Clewses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah -- don't pay to start something with 'em you don't intend to finish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Doc Riding before Rocklin can answer) By the way, Doc, they tell me George'll be out again. (to Rocklin, with the same casual air) That's Bob Clews' brother. Jest done a stretch in pen 'tentiary for horse stealin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They string 'em up for that where I come from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (muttering into his drink) Pity they didn't string him up while they wore about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what Arly Harolday was sayin' only this mornin'. (to Rocklin) You ain't met our Arly yet, I reckon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He will, if he stays here long enough. (chuckles)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell-fire in skirts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (raises his glass; grinning) Well, here's now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Poker table from bar. The flashily-dressed youngster is raking in the stakes triumphantly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What did I tell you? They gotta be big to beat me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Group at bar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Clint Harolday's in luck tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're certainly running for him. About time, too. He's taken a beating this last week would shake a better man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Poker table and including bar. Sammy Haynes has risen and is pushing back his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judge Garvey in foreground has been watching Rocklin, as if trying to sum him up. He now leans forward with an ingratiating smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin smiles and begins to shake his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin turns very slowly and stares at Clint. The others watch curiously. Without taking his eyes off Clint, he comes forward slowly and stands looking down at him. Then, unbuttoning the flap of his pocket, he takes out the wad of bills and drops it on the table, at the same time sinking into the chair vacated by Sammy. The tension amongst the onlookers relaxes and Clint grins at Garvey and winks significantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUN-UP BAR - NIGHT MED. SHOT -- poker table, including Cap, who is watching. Pap Fossler is dealing. There is an atmosphere of tension around the table, and it is obvious that Clint has been losing. As he picks up his cards, he is unable to restrain a smile of triumph. Rocklin makes a bet. Pap Fossler and the man next to him fold immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is more than Rocklin has in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares challengingly at Rocklin. Rocklin takes out a wallet, from which he removes a bill and sees the raise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches for it almost before it is dealt and as a result the card, a Queen, falls face up. Clint looks at it gleefully, snatches it up and puts it in his hand. Rocklin watches him impassively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin glances inquiringly at the other players. All are dead-panned, unwilling to interfere. Rocklin looks toward Cap, who stands near him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shoves all the money in front of him into the pot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clint excitedly starts to rake in the pot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shoves in the money in front of him, which is more than Clint's and in addition takes from his wallet more bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clint, very excited, empties his pockets, which is not enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin starts raking in the pot. Clint, almost hysterical, jumps up, draws his gun and thrusts it almost into Rocklin's face. The other players roll away from the line of fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocklin, his hands outspread, slowly straightens up, rises and backs away. At the foot of the stairs, he turns deliberately and walks upstairs. When he disappears from view -- CLINT - WITH OTHERS AT THE POKER TABLE Clint breaks the tension, looking from one to the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a cold silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cap turns and resumes his trek to the bar. Suddenly he stops before reaching it and is looking up, o.s.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Include me out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw -- come on. Can't you take it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not that sort o' luck, I can't. Besides, I on'y came in to oblige.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning to bar and shouting) Come on, Doc. I still got to take something from you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) No more tonight, son. I've a full day ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about you, sir? Care to sit In? I'm warnin' you, though -- our young friend here has been holding phenomenal cards.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a cocky grin) Have a heart, Judge. This ain't no two-bit saddle-tramp's game. This is for real money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine! Oh -- this is Pap Fossler; Shorty Davis; Ab Jenkins; Mr. Harolday, and my name's Garvey -- Judge Garvey. I didn't get your name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't give it. (to Pap, who is holding the cards) Deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Raise you twenty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Table stakes, Clint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not if he wants to dig.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (folding) No place for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cards?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eagerly) One for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you know that Queen is dead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can take it if I want it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure -- if you want -- but you'll have to beat my hand with four cards.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hotly) I'm playing these, mister!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) I'm not settin' in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smoothly) Why don't you split the pot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not splitting -- I'm betting!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you calling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm raising.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dig.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to other players) Let me have some money
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (speaking for all) You're in deep enough, Clint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disgusted, to Rocklin) I've called for all I've got. (spreads out his cards) Full house.
dialogue.name: dialogue
